caption.p: Total number of clinical trials launched per outbreak as the function of time during the first 24 weeks after the outbreak start date. The start date of each epidemic is defined as the date when authorities, such as the WHO, started listing data on the number of cases. Time is normalized for each outbreak according to this start date (week 0). We used the deposition dates and numbers of clinical trials as recorded in ClinicalTrials.gov. Abbreviations: COVID-19, coronavirus 2019; MERS, Middle East respiratory syndrome; SARS, severe acute respiratory syndrome.
